body.p: Selective cytosolic protein degradation is mediated primarily by the proteasome, which is comprised of a core peptidase and a regulatory cap. Current dogma holds that the 20S core peptidase of the proteasome functions exclusively with the 19S regulatory particle in eukaryotes, with PAN in archaea, and with Mpa in mycobacteria. Barthelme and Sauer (p. 843, published online 26 July 2012; see the Perspective by Matouschek and Finley) now suggest that another type of proteasome can assemble in archaea consisting of the double-ring AAA+ protein, Cdc48, in complex with the 20S core protease.
